title: Donald Trump urges Taiwan to 'pay for its defense'
summary: In an interview with Bloomberg, the Republican candidate in the US presidential election reminded Asian countries benefiting from the American 'umbrella' that they would do better to rely on themselves.

title: In Paris, motorist rams into cafe, one dead, several seriously hurt
summary: The public prosecutor's office said the driver of the vehicle had been arrested. A police source said the initial hypothesis was that the incident was a traffic accident.

title: In the UK, Keir Starmer wants to focus his mandate on economic growth
summary: Two weeks after its election, the Labour government presented its program, focusing on economic recovery, renationalization of the railways and abolition of hereditary peers in the House of Lords.

title: Project 2025, the conservative revolution disrupting Trump's forward march
summary: Democrats are denouncing the liberticidal and extremist aims of the roadmap concocted by experts close to the ex-president. Trump is distancing himself from the project, even though it involves many figures from his former administration.

title: French rugby players accused of rape granted house arrest for now
summary: On Wednesday, the Argentine public prosecutor's office in Mendoza granted the players' request for house arrest in the city pending a hearing to determine whether they will await trial in custody or as free men. They face up to 20 years in prison if found guilty.

title: Paris Mayor Hidalgo dives into the Seine and the Olympic deep end
summary: With less than two years to go before the municipal elections, the mayor of Paris will benefit from the spotlight of the Olympic Games organized in the city, to which she made a major contribution. In her usual way.

title: Biden says could quit race if 'medical condition' emerged
summary: The president's comments were the first time he has opened the door to abandoning the presidential race. They came as Representative Adam Schiff, a key ally from California, urged Biden to 'pass the torch,' on Wednesday. The White House also announced that the president was experiencing 'mild symptoms' after testing positive for Covid.

title: A fire kills 16 people at a shopping mall in southwestern China
summary: Firefighters and rescuers responded to a fire call on Wednesday at a 14-story commercial building in Zigong. It was not immediately known what caused the incident.

title: War in Ukraine: Zelensky wants Russia to take part in a new peace summit
summary: The Ukrainian president's invitation to 'Russian representatives' to attend a peace conference in November suggests a softening of Kyiv's diplomatic stance, against a backdrop of military difficulties.

title: Dior and Armani under investigation for exploiting workers at 'Chinese factories' in Italy
summary: In the Milan region, Italian authorities have discovered undocumented workers living in dormitories in Chinese workshops supplying the Dior and Armani brands.

title: Tour de France: Carapaz wins his first ever stage
summary: The former winner of the road race in the Tokyo Olympics, the Ecuadorian rider won stage 17. While Tadej Pogacar, Jonas Vinegaard and Remco Evenepoel engaged in a late scrap of attacks and counter-attacks.

title: Abbé Pierre, French priest known for charity work, accused of sexual assaults
summary: In a report by two charities he founded, seven women accused Abbé Pierre, who died in 2007, of sexual assaults between 1970 and 2005.

title: US presidential election: Haley and DeSantis pledge allegiance to Trump at Republican convention
summary: On the second day of the convention, the governor of Florida and the former UN ambassador, both defeated and battered during the primaries, praised the Republican candidate.

title: 'The Bear' season 3 can't escape its growing pains
summary: Christopher Storer's series goes through a pause of introspection and uncertainty, illuminated by the creator's writing and the work of the actors.

title: Olympic torch relay: Photo highlights from the tenth week
summary: Relive the highlights of the tenth week of the torch's journey, which reached Paris for two days of celebrations.

title: Pogacar's impossibly fast climb to the Plateau de Beille, the 2024 Tour de France's tipping point
summary: For some years now, each edition of the Tour has had a 'tipping point' when the festive atmosphere at the start gives way to doubts and endless unanswered questions.

title: Sodexo's discreet operations in Russia
summary: The French catering and facilities company tried to keep its work on the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline site invisible, until its withdrawal from the country in 2022. Now an official partner of the Paris Olympic Games, it says that it hasn't violated any sanctions.

title: Nepal, the world champion of political instability
summary: The small Himalayan republic has just appointed its 14th prime minister in 15 years, illustrating a culture of purely transactional public affairs as a growing number of unemployed young people leave the country.

title: Human Rights Watch report debunks Hamas denials of October 7 attack
summary: The investigators believe that Hamas militants are guilty of war crimes and crimes against humanity − refuting the Islamist movement's claims that any atrocities carried out were because of the 'chaos' of the situation.

title: IPCC scientist Sonia Seneviratne: 'We need to let go of the climate of the past'
summary: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' Swiss climatologist Sonia Seneviratne notes that extreme weather events are becoming commonplace. She fears that tipping points with unpredictable consequences may soon be reached.

title: A glossary to understand the situation in French Parliament and government
summary: France's snap elections have brought some procedural or technical terms back to the forefront: Parliamentary groups, presidency of the Assemblée, caretaker government... Le Monde explains them.

title: Bas Devos, director of 'Here': 'Pacing the city is a way of unearthing stories'
summary: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' the Flemish-Belgian filmmaker looks back at the genesis of his fourth feature film, the story of an encounter between a Romanian worker and a botanist specializing in the study of mosses, in a summery Brussels.
